page.title: 14Bonby Slide
page.content: Here you can see the long winding main street of Bonby village typical of several Danish named settlements along the Ancholme valley sheltered from the North and East by the wolds. On either side we have a village Hall,a Post Office,a public house,two farms and a chapel. The chapel was built in 1913 and is still used although it only has a congregation of about six people.Lots of people come on special occasions like Christmas,Harvest Festival and the Silver Jubilee of the crowning of the Queen. One farm is a chicken farm and is owned by Mr.E.Ellis.The other is a cattle farm and belongs to Mr T. and Mr N. Smith.On the farm there are about two hundred cows.Opposite the Church we have another shop called the General Stores.
